page.title: 01Hills Northeast of Ludlow
page.content: Another section of escarpment, low in the south but rising up to clee burf, Brown Clee Hill, at just ander 500m and generally undulating. The streams flow to West and South; the former is by Clee Brook and the latter by Ledwyeke and, tributary, bockletton brooks. the opposite headwaters are within a mile of each other. the two valleys provide suitable sites at about 200m above sea level for two villages, clee St Margaret and Stoke st Milborough. The latter is the larger, with some restoration building taking place at the present. Clee St Margareet has no shop and only a few cottages, houses farms and a church. Elsewhere there is a seatter of a few farms and cottages, the sarp common land being popular. Much of the older, original property is of the local, dull-red sandstone.
